business.headline: Cabinet approves Rs 30,000 crore subsidy to oil companies to keep LPG prices stableThe decision aims to protect consumers from changes in global LPG prices and support the financial health of the public sector oil companies.

Sensex cracks below 80,000 as tariff fears rattle stock marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 765.47 points to close below the psychological 80,000 mark, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 232.85 points to settle at 24,363.30. Midcap and smallcap stocks witnessed deeper cuts, reflecting growing investor unease over the evolving global trade scenario.

India not a dead economy, poised to become 3rd-largest in world: Amitabh KantAfter Donald Trump's 'dead economy' jibe, Amitabh Kant calls India a resilient, reform-driven powerhouse on track to become the world's third-largest economy.

US tariff surge could stall India's manufacturing momentum, warns Moody'sOn Thursday, US President Donald Trump signed an Executive Order that adds a 25% tariff on Indian goods. This move comes in response to India's continued import of oil from Russia.

How much will India's fuel bill rise if it stops buying oil from Russia?Russia currently provides 10% of the world's crude supply. If multiple countries stop buying from Russia at once, crude oil prices could rise by around 10%, as per the report. That would affect everyone, not just India.
Gold hits record high of Rs 1.02 lakh. Is it the right time to buy?The rally in gold comes amid growing concerns over new tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump.

Arvind Panagariya bets on these states to leads India's growth by 2047Arvind Panagariya explained that India doesn't need to push growth artificially. He believes market forces are already at work, shaping the country's growth naturally.

Nitin Gadkari dismisses concerns over ethanol-blended petrol as misinformationUnion Minister Nitin Gadkari firmly defended the government's ethanol-blended petrol initiative, stating that no complaints have surfaced about vehicle issues. Speaking at the India@100 Summit, he challenged critics to cite a single case of malfunction and accused them of spreading baseless misinformation.

Nitin Gadkari's dare on E20 petrol row: Show a single instance of cars facing issueSpeaking at a session during the Business Today India@100 Summit, Nitin Gadkari said no complaints had been reported so far and accused detractors of spreading misinformation about the government's ethanol-blending programme.

NSDL shares are on a dream run after listing. Should you buy now?The NSDL stock, which made its market debut on August 6, has now risen for three straight sessions—prompting IPO investors to ask: is it time to book profits or hold on?

Want to save tax by claiming HRA for rent paid to parents? Read this firstAccording to tax rules, salaried individuals can claim HRA even if they're living in their parents' home. But the rent must be real, paid regularly, and documented properly.

Government may approve Rs 30,000 crore support to maintain LPG price stabilityThis move is aimed at helping oil marketing companies recover losses they have been facing on domestic LPG sales due to high international prices.
Sensex tumbles 500 points: Why is the stock market down today?At 10:07 am, the Sensex was down 496.21 points at 80,127.05, while the Nifty stood at 24,444.55, lower by 151.60 points.

Retail inflation likely dropped to an eight-year low in July: ReportDespite uneven monsoons, a strong spring harvest has helped India keep a lid on food prices, extending the country's longest disinflationary streak in more than a decade.

Sensex, Nifty tumble as Trump's threat on trade deal spooks Dalal StreetAt the opening bell, the S&P BSE Sensex fell over 150 points and was trading 310.53 points lower at 80,312.73 around 9:35 am. The broader Nifty50 index also slipped 84.55 points to 24,511.60.

Trump rules out trade talks with India amid tariffs: Will Dalal Street face the heat?With Donald Trump ruling out any negotiations "until it is resolved," Dalal Street could witness a turbulent period as geopolitical tensions spill into the market.

Trump's tariff: What Indian refiners stand to lose if Russian oil stops flowingFor over two years, Indian refiners have been taking advantage of discounted Russian crude. But with the US tightening its stance, that door may soon begin to close.

US targets one-kilo gold bars with new import tariffs: ReportFollowing the US government's announcement last week of a broad 39% tariff on imports from Switzerland, this exacerbates already existing trade tensions between Bern and Washington.

Trump tariffs: US consumers face price hikes across major brandsIn the household goods sector, Procter & Gamble said it plans to raise prices on 25% of its North American products due to the impact of tariffs and product innovation.

Despite war and warnings, US traded more with Russia than ally UkraineUS President Donald Trump alleges that India has been financing the Russian invasion of Ukraine by importing oil. However, data by the US Census Bureau presents a different picture.

How India plans to tackle Trump's tariff threatIndia has already held five rounds of trade talks with the US, but no deal has been reached. The talks failed mainly because of disagreements over opening India's farm and dairy sectors, and the issue of buying oil from Russia.

Indian refiners hit pause on Russian oil imports after 50% tariff blow: ReportRefiners like Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum Corporation and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation have decided not to buy Russian oil on the spot market in the upcoming buying cycle.
Sensex, Nifty end in green as D-Street investors ignore Trump's 50% tariffsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 79.27 points to end at 80,623.26, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 21.95 points to close at 24,596.15.

Why STP and SWP matter more than SIP, explains stock market expertSIPs help you enter the world of investing. But STPs and SWPs help you navigate it wisely, especially when you have a big lump sum to invest or need steady income without eating into your entire savings.

From ally to 'dead economy': Timeline of Trump's tariff turn on IndiaTrump signed an executive order imposing an additional 25% tariff on Indian goods, bringing the total to 50% on August 6, putting India among the most heavily tariffed nations.

Nayara Energy seeks ships from India to ferry refined fuels: ReportSanctions-hit Nayara is struggling to get vessels for the supply of refined fuels for its retail stations in India. The private refiner has already cut crude runs at its refinery.

Adani to build India's biggest privately funded coal power plant in a decadeThe first of three units at the plant will be commissioned within four years, with the last expected to come online in five years' time, Adani Power said.

TCS hikes salaries for 80% staff amid layoffs: ReportIn a message sent to employees, the company confirmed that the salary increase will apply to around 80% of the workforce and will take effect from September 1, 2025.

How Trump's 100% chip tariff plan has shaken the global semiconductor industrySpeaking from the Oval Office, Trump said the move is aimed at boosting local manufacturing and reducing reliance on foreign-made chips. He added that companies like Apple, which recently committed an extra $100 billion investment in the US, would not be charged the new tariffs.

Trump hits India with 50% tariffs: What's at stake and what next?A sweeping 50% tariff could significantly impact India's export economy, threatening jobs and trade ties. As Donald Trump ramps up pressure, all eyes are now on New Delhi's next move.

From seafood to auto: How will Trump's 50% tariff impact different sectorsThe tariff hike, set to take effect from August 27, follows a warning issued by Trump earlier over India's continued oil imports from Russia.

Skipped your ITR for years? Here's how it can impact you legally and financiallyIt might feel harmless to skip filing your Income Tax Return once or twice, but if you've been ignoring it for years, you could be heading for serious trouble. From steep penalties to even jail time, here's what you need to know before it's too late.

JSW Cement IPO opens for subscription. Should you apply or skip?Brokerages are mostly positive about JSW Cement IPO, though some advise caution due to the stretched valuation and inconsistent profitability.

Sensex tanks 500 points on 50% Trump's tariff blow: Should Investors worry?The Sensex slipped over 250 points at the open before paring some losses. The Nifty50 was also trading lower, reflecting broad-based caution and expectations of a volatile trading session.

Sensex, Nifty fall as Trump announces additional tariffs; experts advise cautionWhile Sensex opened 250 points lower, it was trading just 131.05 points lower at 80,412.94 at 9:22 am, indicating that the session could see wild swings and high volatility. Nifty50 was also down 67.25 points to 24,506.95.

How India can turn Trump's tariffs into a strategic advantageThe new tariff of an additional 25%, announced on Wednesday, will come into effect 21 days from August 7. This sharp increase in duties comes at a time when trade talks between the two countries have reached a dead end.

PM's Economic Advisory Council members on Trump's tariff war, India's growth strategyPrime Minister Narendra Modi's Economic Advisory Council members, Dr Sajjid Chinoy and Neelkanth Mishra, share their perspectives on the additional 25 per cent tariffs imposed by Donald Trump on Indian imports to the US over buying Russian oil and India's growth strategy.

ICICI, HDFC, Union Bank and others offer attractive 3-year FD rates. Should you invest now?FDs remain one of the safest investment options for those looking for steady returns without risk. However, with repo rates possibly heading downward in the future, locking in higher FD rates now could be a smart financial move.

Should you subscribe to this IPO with over 50% listing gains? Check detailsThe public issue is worth Rs 130 crore, made up of a fresh issue of 1.39 crore shares amounting to Rs 97.52 crore, and an offer for sale of 46 lakh shares worth Rs 32.48 crore.

entertainment.headline: Malti crashes Nick's rehearsals, Priyanka celebrates early Rakhi in new photo dumpPriyanka Chopra shared a photo dump featuring all the memorable moments of her family. The carousel featured her daughter Malti enjoying her time at beach and crashing into the Jonas Brothers' rehearsal.

Smriti Irani reacts to Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi reboot topping TV, OTT chartsActor-politician Smriti Irani is elated as her show 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot is topping the ratings. Irani expressed her gratitude to fans and viewers for their love and support.

Actor Ashish Vidyarthi says he won't return to Bollywood without central rolesVeteran actor Ashish Vidyarthi shares why he's stepped back from films, stating he's waiting for central roles that truly excite him.

Explained: The controversy around Marathi film Khalid Ka ShivajiThe Marathi film 'Khalid Ka Shivaji' has sparked controversy over its portrayal of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. Right-wing groups claim historical distortion, while the Centre seeks clarification from filmmakers.

Varun Badola backtracks on Saiyaara remark, says his words were misrepresentedActor Varun Badola has clarified that his earlier comments about Saiyaara's promotions were misrepresented. He stated that malicious attempts were being made to tarnish the Mohit Suri directorial.

Jennifer Lopez shops at rival brands after being denied entry at Chanel storeActor Jennifer Lopez was refused entry to a Chanel store in Istanbul due to full capacity. She later shopped at rival luxury brands, highlighting a rare celebrity shopping snub.

Coolie advance booking soars in Kerala, Rajinikanth's film set for massive openingSuperstar Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' eyes the biggest international opening for a Tamil film. The film's advance bookings in Kerala show a promising momentum at the box office.

Jimmy Fallon trolls Trump's India tariffs, jokes about Putin and Sydney SweeneyJimmy Fallon roasted President Trump's tariff plans affecting over 90 countries, including India and Brazil. The American comedian, in his monologue, highlighted the economic impacts surrounding Trump's trade policies.

Is Sydney Sweeney part of The Devil Wears Prada 2? Fans think soHollywood actor Sydney Sweeney sparks casting rumours after being captured on 'The Devil Wears Prada 2' set, amid backlash over her American Eagle ad campaign.

Chhoriyan Chali Gaon: Anita promises to support village children after show wrapsActor Anita Hassanandani said she will continue to support the children she's staying with in MP's Bamuliya village. Her support came on the reality TV show 'Chhoriyan Chali Gaon' on Zee TV.

Singer Ed Sheeran turns bride for Harry Potter star Rupert Grint. WatchPop star Ed Sheeran turned into a bride for Harry Potter star Rupert Grint, known for playing the role of Ronald Weasley in the popular fantasy franchise. He was previously featured as Ed Sheeran's stalker in the 2011 music video 'Lego House'.

Karan Aujla, Honey Singh summoned by Punjab Women's Commission over vulgar lyricsKaran Aujla and Honey Singh's recent songs face criticism for alleged offensive language, prompting action by the Punjab State Women's Commission.

How K-drama's female actors are rewriting revenge storiesFrom 'The Glory' to 'My Name', K-drama female leads are ditching the damsel-in-distress trope for fierce, calculated revenge. In this week's K-fix we'll discuss how they're redefining power on-screen.

Kammatam: Malayalam crime thriller, based on true events, to stream on Zee5Zee5 is set to release 'Kammatam', a six-episode Malayalam crime thriller series based on a controversial Thrissur case.  The show stars Sudev Nair and unravels a gripping investigation filled with secrets and suspense.

Andhera trailer: Surveen Chawla, Prakajta and Karanvir Malhotra face sinister evilThe trailer of 'Andhera' featuring Surveen Chawla, Prajakta Koli, and Karanvir Malhotra is out. The eight-episode series will premiere on Prime Video on August 14.

Honey Singh releases One Thousand Miles music video 11 years after its launchRapper-singer Honey Singh finally released the video for his song 'One Thousand Miles' on Friday. The audio, which was a part of Singh's 'Desi Kalaakar' album, was released in 2014.

Jatadhara teaser: Sudheer Babu's selflessness clashes with Sonakshi Sinha's greedThe teaser of Sonakshi Sinha and Sudheer Babu's 'Jatadhara' released today. The mythical supernatural thriller is directed by Venkat Kalyan and Abhishek Jaiswal.

How Chhoriyan Chali Gaon is changing the way we look at Indian reality TV'Chhoriyan Chali Gaon', a new show on Zee TV, is bringing a refreshing twist to Indian reality TV. It features 11 celebrities from city life adapting to a rural village in Madhya Pradesh. Some of the contestants include actor Anita Hassanandani, comedian Sumukhi Suresh and influencer duo Chinki-Minki.

Kapil Sharma shoots with Janhvi Kapoor-Sidharth Malhotra amid Bishnoi gang threatsIt was business as usual for comedian Kapil Sharma as he began shooting with Janhvi Kapoor and Sidharth Malhotra for his show a day after gunshots were fired at his restaurant in Canada by the members of the Bishnoi gang.

general news.headline: PM speaks to Putin, reaffirms commitment to deepen ties amid Trump's tariff heatPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said he had a "very good and detailed conversation" with Russian President Vladimir Putin and reaffirmed India's commitment to deepen the strategic partnership between both countries amid US President Donald Trump's 50 per cent tariffs on Indian goods.

India will not bow to anybody, says Piyush Goyal amid trade warsSpeaking on the broader trade outlook, Piyush Goyal said that India's IT industry has not looked back since the year 2000, creating thousands of jobs, and noted that the country had turned the Covid-19 crisis into an opportunity. "India will always emerge victorious during challenging times," he said.

No decision to scrap India-US defence deals after Trump tariffs: SourcesDays after US President Donald Trump doubled India's tariffs to 50 per cent, sources told India Today TV that no decision has been taken to cancel defence deals with Washington, DC, and that the status quo on defence procurement has been maintained.

US picked wrong target: Tharoor calls Trump 'school bully' over 'dead economy' jibeSpeaking to India Today's Consulting Editor Rajdeep Sardesai about Donald Trump's "dead economy" jab, Shashi Tharoor said that India's self-respect was sacrosanct and "simply not up for bargaining".

Voter Fraud is Real, Let's Talk SolutionsIn his presentation titled 'Vote Chori', Rahul Gandhi claimed that in a state his party won, unaccounted voters stole the elections by voting or not voting. While the voter list seems to be a problem, even the SIR to fix it has sparked controversy. What's the solution then?

Apologise or sign declaration: Poll body to Rahul Gandhi over voter theft chargeThe Election Commission of India on Friday doubled down on its attack on Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, daring the Congress MP to either sign the poll body's declaration form—mandated for raising objections to the electoral roll—or "apologise to the nation for raising absurd allegations."

Couple claims Delhi restaurant refused entry over Indian attire. Video goes viralIn a now-viral video shared on social media, the woman was seen dressed in a churidaar-kurta set while her partner wore a T-shirt and pants as both claimed they were stopped at the entrance due to their attire.

China welcomes PM's SCO Summit visit, calls it gathering of solidarity, friendshipChinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Guo Jiakun said the SCO summit, to be held from August 31 to September 1, will see participation from leaders of over 20 countries, including all member states.

Dangerous to reduce age of consent for sex below 18: Centre in Supreme CourtThe Centre defended the age of consent at 18 as essential to protecting minors, warning that lowering it would weaken child protection and enable abuse. It opposed exceptions, saying girls risk being exploited under the guise of consent. This came after senior advocate Indira Jaising urged the SC to reduce the age to 16, citing the criminalisation of adolescent relationships.

Why additional Trump tariffs will be a big pain point for IndiaThe extra 25 per cent 'ad valorem' duty on Indian imports—seen as a new negotiating tactic by the Trump administration—will have a sizeable impact on India's growth in the short term

Won't forgive Rahul Gandhi for echoing Trump's 'dead economy' jibe: Piyush GoyalSpeaking at a session during the Business Today India@100 Summit, Piyush Goyal said India has a bright future and called it shameful that the leader of the opposition repeated a negative story.

Frozen bodies holding guns: When 120 bahadur took on 5,000 Chinese soldiersJust 120 Indian soldiers, led by Major Shaitan Singh Bhati, beat back 5,000 Chinese troopers at Rezang La in 1962, preventing China's takeover of Ladakh. A search party found frozen bodies of Indian soldiers still holding guns, showing the last stand in which 110 of the 120 Indians were killed. Revisiting the legendary battle of the 1962 Indo-China war, which is the subject of Farhan Akhtar's 120 Bahadur.

What India-US trade tensions mean for Indian students' education plans abroadIf the diplomatic relationship continues to sour, future work visa opportunities like the H-1B or post-study Optional Practical Training programmes could face tighter caps or restrictions.

MP High Court says 'ideal Indian wife' tolerates decades of desertion by husbandThe court said that this was a unique case depicting the loyalty of the wife as a typical Indian woman, who puts all her efforts into saving her family life.

Income Tax Bill 2025, introduced in February, withdrawn; new version on August 11A new version of the Income Tax Bill, incorporating most of the recommendations made by the Select Committee chaired by Baijayant Panda, will be introduced on Monday.

India-Russia bear hug is another Trump self-goalThough India and Russia had strong ties, New Delhi was trying to balance that as relations with the US were on the upswing. However, Donald Trump's tariff bazooka might see India's Russia hug get tighter. Russian President Putin is set to visit New Delhi later this year. Trump has, ironically, driven India towards Russia like the US did with its arms embargo in the mid-60s.

Sholay@50: The Making of Gabbar, Bollywood's Greatest VillainWhat made Gabbar Singh the greatest villain in Bollywood history? It wasn't just Amjad's performance, though his raw intensity was undeniable. It was the magic of Salim-Javed's writing, Sippy's vision, and Amjad's ability to transcend the archetype of the Bollywood villain.

Cabinet approves Rs 30,000 crore subsidy to oil companies to keep LPG prices stableThe decision aims to protect consumers from changes in global LPG prices and support the financial health of the public sector oil companies.

80 voters in 10 sq ft house: India Today ground check on Rahul Gandhi's claimAfter Rahul Gandhi's explosive vote fraud claims, India Today's ground check in Bengaluru Central found 80 voters registered at a 10-15 sq ft house in Muni Reddy Garden. The current occupant denied links to them. The property's owner admitted many former tenants still return to vote.

17 dead, 33 missing in China flash floods, landslide, Xi orders all-out rescue opsRelentless rains have triggered deadly flash floods in China's Gansu province, killing at least 10. The disaster comes as the country battles some of its worst August downpours in decades.

Kerala man stalks colleague in UK despite arrests, faces deportationA 26-year-old Kerala man is facing deportation from the UK after repeatedly stalking his female colleague at London Zoo, despite multiple arrests and bail conditions. Asish Jose Paul allegedly harassed the woman with messages, gifts, and showed up to her workplace uninvited. He has now been given a six-month sentence, suspended for one year.

Malti crashes Nick's rehearsals, Priyanka celebrates early Rakhi in new photo dumpPriyanka Chopra shared a photo dump featuring all the memorable moments of her family. The carousel featured her daughter Malti enjoying her time at beach and crashing into the Jonas Brothers' rehearsal.

Varun Badola backtracks on Saiyaara remark, says his words were misrepresentedActor Varun Badola has clarified that his earlier comments about Saiyaara's promotions were misrepresented. He stated that malicious attempts were being made to tarnish the Mohit Suri directorial.

sports.headline: PV Sindhu lone Indian seed at World Championships in ParisPV Sindhu is the only Indian singles player seeded at the 2025 World Badminton Championships in Paris. The tournament faces a setback as Olympic champion Viktor Axelsen withdraws due to injury concerns.

Priyansh Arya becomes first player to hit multiple hundreds in DPLPriyansh Arya roared back to form in the Delhi Premier League (DPL) 2025 with a blistering 111 off 56 balls for Outer Delhi Warriors against East Delhi Riders on Friday, 8 August.

IPL trade rules explained: Player exchanges, all-cash deals and moreThe IPL trading window could see some high-profile moves ahead of the 2026 season with two Indian stars rumoured to make a switch. Let us take a look at the rules regarding the trading period.

Who is Victoria Mboko? 18-year-old sensation shines with Canadian Open title18-year-old Victoria Mboko won the Canadian Open title after beating  four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka 2-6, 6-4, 6-1 in the final on Thursday, August 7.

Who is Haider Ali? Once Pakistan's U19 World Cup star amid criminal investigationYoung Pakistan batter Haider Ali has been suspended by the Pakistan Cricket Board after he was arrested last month in Manchester during the Pakistan Shaheens' tour of England.

IPL 2026: R Ashwin in talks with CSK over future, may join new franchiseFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, who was signed by the Chennai Super Kings in the mega auction ahead of the 2025 Indian Premier League (IPL) season, is currently in discussions with the five-time champions regarding his future with the franchise.

Virat Kohli begins training for ODI comeback in London, IPL coach joins himVirat Kohli has begun practising for his return to ODI cricket in London. The former captain is set to play for India in a three-match ODI series in Australia from October 19 to 25.

Croatia's Zach Vukusic becomes historic youngest-ever international captainZak Vukusic made history on Thursday after becoming the youngest captain in international cricket. He broke the record of France's Noman Amjad, who held the record earlier at 18 years and 24 days.

Slot excited for Crystal Palace challenge, confirms Nunez's exit talksArne Slot remains excited for Liverpool's clash against Crystal Palace for the FA Community Shield. The Premier League-winning coach knows that a tricky opposition awaits them at Wembley. He also talked about Darwin Nunez and his rumoured exit.

Gill silences doubters, Jadeja stands tall: Parthiv Patel on England tourENG vs IND: Parthiv Patel was all praise for both Shubman Gill and Ravindra Jadeja for their performances in the England Test series, implying that the two had a key role in their success.

Virat Kohli begins training for ODI comeback in London, IPL coach joins himVirat Kohli has begun practising for his return to ODI cricket in London. The former captain is set to play for India in a three-match ODI series in Australia from October 19 to 25.

Croatia's Zach Vukusic becomes historic youngest-ever international captainZak Vukusic made history on Thursday after becoming the youngest captain in international cricket. He broke the record of France's Noman Amjad, who held the record earlier at 18 years and 24 days.

The Premier League-winning coach knows that a tricky opposition awaits them at Wembley. He also talked about Darwin Nunez and his rumoured exit.

Gill silences doubters, Jadeja stands tall: Parthiv Patel on England tourENG vs IND: Parthiv Patel was all praise for both Shubman Gill and Ravindra Jadeja for their performances in the England Test series, implying that the two had a key role in their success.

Karun Nair looked shaken: Irfan Pathan rates India batter 4/10 for England seriesFormer India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has criticised Karun Nair for failing to make the most of his Test comeback, pointing to the batter's inconsistent scores and squandered opportunities during the Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy series.

Harry Kane praises special Heung-min Son following ex-team-mate's Spurs exitBayern Munich striker Harry Kane paid tribute to his former team-mate Heung-min Son following his departure from Tottenham Hotspur. Son joined Los Angeles FC on Wednesday in a record-breaking Major League Soccer transfer.

ICC pitch ratings for England vs India revealed: Only Leeds gets good ratingThree pitches used in the Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy failed to get the highest ICC rating. The Leeds pitch at Headingley stood out as the only one rated very good. India and England shared the trophy after a drawn series.

Bob Carter steps down as New Zealand Cricket high-performance coach after 21 yearsFormer New Zealand Women's head coach Bob Carter is stepping away from his role as New Zealand Cricket's (NZC) high-performance coach after 21 years.

He's a bit of a clown: Moeen Ali says Warner's mind games won't work on Joe RootFormer England cricketer Moeen Ali dismissed David Warner's take on Joe Root's chances of scoring big in the Ashes in Australia later this year. Root is yet to score a hundred Down Under.

Ben Shelton wins biggest crown of career, elated with steely show ahead of US OpenBen Shelton claimed his first ATP 1000 title by winning the National Bank Open in Toronto. This victory makes him the youngest American Masters 1000 champion since 2004 and positions him as a strong contender ahead of the US Open.

Sanju Samson to leave RR due to Vaibhav Suryavanshi's rise? Ex-opener explainsFormer India opener Aakash Chopra believes that Vaibhav Suryavanshi's rise might've played a role in Sanju Samson's reported departure from Rajasthan Royals (RR).

Virat Kohli spotted in London with greying beard, sparking speculation among fansFormer India captain Virat Kohli was spotted in London sporting a salt-and-pepper look. A section of fans took note of his greying beard, linking it to a remark he made earlier this year.

He's a bit of a clown: Moeen Ali says Warner's mind games won't work on Joe RootFormer England cricketer Moeen Ali dismissed David Warner's take on Joe Root's chances of scoring big in the Ashes in Australia later this year. Root is yet to score a hundred Down Under.

Ben Shelton wins biggest crown of career, elated with steely show ahead of US OpenBen Shelton claimed his first ATP 1000 title by winning the National Bank Open in Toronto. This victory makes him the youngest American Masters 1000 champion since 2004 and positions him as a strong contender ahead of the US Open.

Sanju Samson to leave RR due to Vaibhav Suryavanshi's rise? Ex-opener explainsFormer India opener Aakash Chopra believes that Vaibhav Suryavanshi's rise might've played a role in Sanju Samson's reported departure from Rajasthan Royals (RR).

Virat Kohli spotted in London with greying beard, sparking speculation among fansFormer India captain Virat Kohli was spotted in London sporting a salt-and-pepper look. A section of fans took note of his greying beard, linking it to a remark he made earlier this year.

WI vs PAK: Matthew Forde ruled out of ODI series due to shoulder injuryWest Indies fast bowler Matthew Forde has been ruled out of the ODI series against Pakistan after dislocating his shoulder practice session. He has been replaced by Johann Layne.

Cheer for Mohammed Siraj, but don't jeer Jasprit Bumrah England vs India: Mohammed Siraj's brilliance at The Oval deserves every decibel of praise. But that celebration need not come at the cost of Jasprit Bumrah, the architect of several Indian triumphs.

18-year-old Victoria Mboko stuns Naomi Osaka to win Canadian OpenVictoria Mboko staged a stunning comeback after losing the first set to beat Naomi Osaka 2-6, 6-4, 6-1 in the final. The 18-year-old became the first Canadian to defeat three former Grand Slam champions in a single WTA event in the Open Era

Gambhir assured my son that he will get chances: Abhimanyu Easwaran's fatherAbhimanyu Easwaran's father, Ranganathan Easwaran, has revealed that India head coach Gautam Gambhir has assured his son of getting chances in the playing XI. Abhimanyu couldn't find a place in the playing XI in the five-match Test series against England.

Dinesh Karthik hits back at Bumrah's critics: India's defeats are not his faultFormer India cricketer turned commentator Dinesh Karthik has slammed Jasprit Bumrah's critics, saying that it's not his fault that India lost Test matches in England despite his presence.

Who after Bumrah and Siraj? Is India's fast-bowling assembly line drying up?With Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj now past 30, the big question looms: who takes over as the leader of India's pace attack? Among the frontrunners are Arshdeep Singh, Akash Deep, Prasidh Krishna, and Harshit Rana - all promising, but yet to fully cement their place.

Pakistan Cricket Board suspends Haider Ali amid UK criminal investigation: ReportThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has provisionally suspended cricketer Haider Ali after it emerged that the 24-year-old batter is under criminal investigation by Greater Manchester Police in the United Kingdom.

Chennai Grandmasters 2025: Erigaisi takes dominant win, Keymer downs SarinArjun Erigaisi kicked off his Chennai Grandmasters campaign with a dominant win over Awonder Liang, while Vincent Keymer stunned Nihal Sarin in the opening round of this high-stakes tournament.

Ashes 2025: Glenn McGrath backs Australia to whitewash England 5-0Legendary pacer Glenn McGrath predicts a 5-0 Ashes whitewash for Australia in the 2025–26 series. McGrath's confidence stems from Australia's strong bowling lineup and favourable home conditions, posing a tough challenge for England.

Shikhar Dhawan pens emotional post for son Zoraver during WCL stintIn a heartfelt post, Shikhar Dhawan opened up about his son Zoraver, offering a rare glimpse into a deeply personal side of his life. Sharing a series of previously unseen photographs, the cricketer reflected on fatherhood, separation, and the small moments that continue to linger long after they've passed.

2nd Test: Henry eclipses Taylor's return as New Zealand take control on Day 1Matt Henry continued his outstanding form with another five-wicket haul as New Zealand took firm control of the second Test in Bulawayo, bowling Zimbabwe out for 125 and reaching 174 for 1 in reply by stumps on the opening day.

Duleep Trophy: Jurel to lead Central Zone, Karun left out amid Test returnDhruv Jurel is set to lead Central Zone in the upcoming Duleep Trophy campaign. The spin-bowling unit will have Kuldeep Yadav leading the line alongside Harsh Dubey and Manav Suthar.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
